title: PCT 30: A dead Blackfoot recovers his ornaments
author: Simon Mimikwas

sentences.english: Once upon a time, long ago, four Cree set out;
their horses were very fleet, and they went to steal horses.
They did not succeed in stealing any.
Then at one time they attacked a young man from ambush.
They killed him.
Then they scalped him.

sentences.original: êkosi tapasîwak; êkotê kont îtêh kâsôwak; kotakihk sipwêhtêwak.
sentences.text: êkosi tapasîwak êkotê konita itê kâsôwak kotakihk sipwêhtêwak
sentences.english: Then they fled; they hid somewhere or other; they went off to another place.
They saw a village of many tents.
There, then, they stole.
They managed to lay their hands on many horses.
Each took two of them.
Then they fled in the night.
All night long they rode in flight.

sentences.original: êh-wâpahk, itah kô-kimoticik, kâwih êkotah takosinwak.
sentences.text: ê-wâpahk ita kôh-kimoticik kâwi êkota takosinwak
sentences.english: At daybreak they arrived again at the place where they had stolen horses.
So they let the horses go.
At once they were pursued, by the Blackfoot they were pursued.
But as their horses were fleet, they outdistanced their pursuers.
When the others knew that they could not overtake them, they quit them.
So they went on towards home.
When they had been exactly four nights on the way, in the morning they killed game.
There they prepared meat.
They ate there.
After their meal, they went on.
It was cold, for it was nearly winter.
Presently they came in sight of a tent.
When night fell, they approached it.

sentences.original: êkotah ê-takohtêcik, wâpamêwak misatimwah nîso, êh-nipahcikâsôyit.
sentences.text: êkota ê-takohtêcik wâpamêwak misatimwa nîso ê-nipahcikâsoyit
sentences.english: When they reached it, they saw two horses that had been killed.
So they withdrew.
In the morning they went there.
They broke open the tent.
When they entered, there lay a man who had died, a Blackfoot.

sentences.original: otinêwak êh-tâpiskawâyit pîwâpiskominisah mihcêt, otakohpiyiwah mînah.
sentences.text: otinêwak ê-tâpiskawâyit pîwâpiskominisa mihcêt otakohpiyiwa mîna
sentences.english: They took a great number of metal beads which he had as a necklace, and his blanket-robes.
They must have stripped the man completely.
Thereupon they departed.
Presently, when they were quite a ways, there he came a-whooping.
When they looked back, they saw him coming in pursuit of them.
They fled;
he kept close upon them.
At last their horses went out of breath.
Then at one time he called to them: “Bring here what ye have robbed from me!”
Still they did not want to give him the things.
With all their might they fled.

sentences.original: kîtahtawê wêpinam otakohpiyiwah, pêyik êh-nayawapiyit otêmah.
sentences.text: kîtahtawê wêpinam otakohpiyiwa pêyak ê-nayawapiyit otêma
sentences.english: Presently one whose horse was winded threw away a blanket of the man's.
When he looked back, the other came up to it and took it.
Still he came chasing them.

sentences.original: êkoyikohk mitonih wiy-atimik awah kâ-nayawapiyit otêmah.
sentences.text: êkoyikohk mitoni wî-atimik awa kâ-nayawapiyit otêma
sentences.english: By this time he had almost overtaken the one whose horse was out of breath.
So the latter called to his companions.
“Throw away all the things you took,” he cried to his companions.
Accordingly they threw away everything.

sentences.original: nayêstaw pîwâpiskominisah namoya wêpinêw pêyak, osâm êh-miywêyimât.
sentences.text: nayêstaw pîwâpiskominisa namôya wêpinêw pêyak osâm ê-miywêyimât
sentences.english: Only one did not throw away the metal beads, because he liked them too much.

sentences.original: êkosi êh-âpasâpit, kâ-wêpinahkik anihih êh-pêh-otihtamiyit, otinamiyiwah.
sentences.text: êkosi ê-âpasâpit kâ-wêpinahkik anihi ê-pê-otihtamiyit otinamiyiwa
sentences.english: When he looked back, the other reached the things they had thrown down and took them.
He still kept after them.

sentences.original: mitonih ê-wih-atimikocik, êkoyikohk oskinîkiw awah k-âyâwât pîwâpiskominisah kiskêyihtam êh-nawayapiyit otêmah.
sentences.text: mitoni ê-wî-atimikocik êkoyikohk oskinîkiw awa kâ-ayâwât pîwâpiskominisa kiskêyihtam ê-nayawapiyit otêma
sentences.english: When he was very close upon them, the youth who had the metal beads perceived that his horse was out of breath.
He took thought; he laid hold of the metal beads and threw them down.

sentences.original: êh-otihtâyit matwê-sâkowêyiwah, namoya misawâc takîh-maskamiyêk niwawêsihonah!
sentences.english: When the other reached them, he whooped aloud, “Not after all will ye be able to despoil me of my fineries!”
Thereupon he quit them,
and they returned home.
That is all.
